Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the study for which the consent is being sought?
A) The study is a routine medical evaluation that does not involve research.
B) The study is a non-randomized observational study without any interventions.
C) The study is a randomized clinical trial that involves research to evaluate a treatment for body image concerns in head and neck cancer survivors.
D) The study is a commercial survey conducted by a pharmaceutical company for marketing purposes.

Correct answer: C) The study is a randomized clinical trial that involves research to evaluate a treatment for body image concerns in head and neck cancer survivors.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the BRIGHT study for head and neck cancer survivors?
A) To compare the effectiveness of two different surgical techniques; B) To assess the impact of a new chemotherapy drug; C) To evaluate the effectiveness of a telemedicine-based cognitive behavioral therapy for body image concerns; D) To provide financial assistance for cancer treatment

Correct answer: C

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How many months will participants be involved in the BRIGHT study for head and neck cancer survivors?
A) 3 months; B) 6 months; C) 9 months; D) 12 months
Correct answer: C) 9 months

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the additional costs you may incur as a result of participating in this research study?
A) You will be responsible for all medical and therapy costs associated with the study.
B) There will be no additional costs to you for procedures required in this research study, but routine clinical care will be billed to you or your insurance.
C) The study will cover all medical and therapy costs, including routine clinical care and any additional treatments.
D) You will receive all treatments and procedures free of charge, including those not related to the study.

Correct answer: B) There will be no additional costs to you for procedures required in this research study, but routine clinical care will be billed to you or your insurance.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What is the correct sequence of steps a participant will undergo after agreeing to participate in the BRIGHT study for head and neck cancer survivors?

A) Complete baseline questionnaires, be randomly assigned to a group, undergo six weekly telemedicine sessions, and complete follow-up questionnaires.
B) Undergo a physical examination, receive six weeks of medication, and attend a final in-person assessment.
C) Be randomly assigned to a group, receive a medical device for home monitoring, and attend monthly in-person follow-up visits.
D) Attend an educational seminar, receive a series of injections, and participate in a focus group discussion.

Correct answer: A) Complete baseline questionnaires, be randomly assigned to a group, undergo six weekly telemedicine sessions, and complete follow-up questionnaires.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to be enrolled in the study from the Medical University of South Carolina (MUSC)?
A) 50; B) 75; C) 100; D) 150
Correct answer: B) 75

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What are the potential risks or discomforts that participants might experience in this study?
A) Physical risks from medical procedures; B) Discomfort from discussing personal body image concerns; C) Risk of exposure to radiation; D) Risk of surgical complications

Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential benefit that participants may experience from the BRIGHT study for head and neck cancer survivors?
A) Guaranteed elimination of body image concerns
B) Possible decrease in body image concerns and improved quality of life
C) Financial compensation for medical expenses incurred during the study
D) Immediate access to new head and neck cancer treatments outside of the study

Correct answer: B) Possible decrease in body image concerns and improved quality of life

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the confidentiality measures for your personal health information in this study?
A) Your personal health information may be shared with anyone without restrictions.
B) Your personal health information is protected by a Certificate of Confidentiality and cannot be disclosed without your consent, except as required by law.
C) Your personal health information will be made public as part of the study results.
D) The study does not include any measures to maintain the confidentiality of your personal health information.

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
What should a participant do if they are injured as a result of participation in the study, and who will be responsible for the treatment costs?

A) The participant should contact the study sponsor for immediate medical treatment and the sponsor will cover all costs.
B) The participant should go to the emergency room of the Medical University Hospital or the nearest hospital, and the study sponsor may not cover the treatment costs.
C) The participant should wait for a scheduled study visit to report the injury, and no costs will be incurred for any treatment related to the injury.
D) The participant should treat themselves, as no medical treatment is available for injuries related to the study.

Correct answer: B) The participant should go to the emergency room of the Medical University Hospital or the nearest hospital, and the study sponsor may not cover the treatment costs.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject

A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form state about your right to decline participation in the study?

A) Declining to participate will result in a loss of medical benefits you are currently entitled to.
B) You may face certain penalties if you choose not to participate in the study.
C) You can choose not to participate or to stop participating at any time without any impact on your medical care or benefits you are entitled to.
D) If you refuse to participate, you will be required to pay a fee.

Correct answer: C) You can choose not to participate or to stop participating at any time without any impact on your medical care or benefits you are entitled to.
